At the risk of asking a dumb question ...

Can someone elaborate more on why "Declared exceptions are a work of the devil"?
What are declared exceptions in this context, and why are they so bad?

thanks for your patience


--- In junit@egroups.com, tony.heap@t... wrote:
> ...the question is: does anyone know why
> AssertionFailedException is an Error and not a RuntimeException -
> according to Sun's guidelines on exception handling you should not
be
> trying to catch and handle Errors, but I do want to, in order to be
> able to display a 'pretty' error message in my production system.

Declared exceptions are a work of the devil. Seemed like a good idea
at while Old Nick was explaining them, but now the bill is coming due
and the benefits are not worth the cost. That's just our opinion, but
there you have it.

Kent
